After a day of delay and rancor with warring sides calling the others traitors and terrorists, the Syrian peace talks kicked off this morning for the first ever direct negotiations.
The Syrian government delegation sat across the negotiating table with the Syrian opposition to find a political solution to a war in which more than 100,000 have died.
After all the intense drama of the past few days, the meeting opened with little fanfare.

Hello there, Deb.
Good morning.

Tell us about the dynamics in the negotiating room today and what you're expecting.

The delegates enter from different doors.

It's been decided which side of the table they'll sit on, how far apart.

negotiator, Lakhdar Brahimi, it's the most inaccessible room within the United Nations compound here in Geneva.

and Russia not to walk out.
